Body: Description: Hello, Customer name is RubyPlay. They've observed the behavior when Lightshot's screenshot URL is not blocking when sending to the Slack by instant messaging. Example of the URL: https://prnt.sc/YsO3xGTe2ID9 We have added next items into the Denylist: //prnt.sc/ https://prnt.sc/ prnt.sc —Åonfidential These URLs successfully blocking if transferred to DLPTest.com, but if thy to send it to Slack it goes through. We recreated the scenario in our environment, so you should be able too. I will attach logs and screenshots. Please look into this behavior, if you have any clarification question, please let us know.
Next Steps Updated: waiting on R&D

What We've Learned Updated: - EPP is not detecting sensitive content via Slack when uploading a screenshot from Lightshot
- We were able to reproduce the issue internally.
- Logs we're collected and a recording was also made
- opened R&D escalation

What We've Learned Updated: - EPP is not detecting sensitive content via Slack when uploading a screenshot from Lightshot
- We were able to reproduce the issue internally.
- Logs we're collected and a recording was also made
- opened R&D escalation

02.04
- test build provided to customer
- they tested it and the block is successful, but the last connection is shown as "Unknown" and there is no notification Pop-up appear after the block
- forwarded the feedback and the logs to the R&D team

What We've Learned Updated: 14.02
- EPP is not detecting sensitive content via Slack when uploading a screenshot from Lightshot
- We were able to reproduce the issue internally.
- Logs we're collected and a recording was also made

19.02
- opened R&D escalation

26.03
- issue is still being investigated
- after asking the customer, I let the R&D team know the issue is present on the latest build as well

02.04
- test build provided to customer
- they tested it and the block is successful, but the last connection is shown as "Unknown" and there is no notification Pop-up appear after the block
- forwarded the feedback and the logs to the R&D team

17.04
- received feedback from R&D that the bug is going to be fixed in the next client
- asked them if they can provide a test build
